Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.30701481] Gram-positive bacteria:Staphylococcus aureus(MIC=0.9-1.5μmol/L), Bacillus subtilis(MIC=0.6-1.2μmol/L);Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli JM 109(MIC=0.6-1.2 μmol/L), Salmonella typhimurium(MIC=0.3-0.6μmol/L)
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.30701481] 0% hemolysis at 45 μmol/L and >0% hemolysis at 60 μmol/L against sheep blood cells
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: [Ref.30701481] The average inhibitory rate of the hybrid peptide in the SMMC-7721 cells was 19.14%.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive bacteria and Gram-nagetive bacteria.

Literature.Title: Design and activity study of a melittin–thanatin hybrid peptide
Literature.Reference: AMB Express. 2019; 9 14. Published online 2019 Jan 30. doi 10.1186/s13568-019-0739-z
Literature.Author: Xiaofeng Jiang, Kun Qian, Guangping Liu, Laiyu Sun, Guoqing Zhou, Jingfen Li, Xinqiang Fang, Haixia Ge, Zhengbing Lv
